comment: Smart data models - CoolingTower schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.S4BLDG/master/CoolingTower/schema.json
description: A cooling tower is a device which rejects heat to ambient air by circulating a fluid such as water through it to reduce its temperature by partial evaporation.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: ambientDesignDryBulbTemperature
contents.comment: Property. Ambient design dry bulb temperature used for selecting the cooling tower. Usually measured in degrees Kelvin (K).

contents.name: ambientDesignWetBulbTemperature
contents.comment: Property. Ambient design wet bulb temperature used for selecting the cooling tower. Usually measured in degrees Kelvin (K).

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: basinReserveVolume
contents.comment: Property. Volume between operating and overflow levels in cooling tower basin. Usually measured in cubic metre (m3).

contents.name: capacityControl
contents.comment: Property. FanCycling: Fan is cycled on and off to control duty. TwoSpeedFan: Fan is switched between low and high speed to control duty. VariableSpeedFan: Fan speed is varied to control duty. DampersControl: Dampers modulate the air flow to control duty. BypassValveControl: Bypass valve modulates the water flow to control duty. MultipleSeriesPumps: Turn on/off multiple series pump to control duty. TwoSpeedPump: Switch between high/low pump speed to control duty. VariableSpeedPump: vary pump speed to control

contents.name: circuitType
contents.comment: Property. OpenCircuit: Exposes water directly to the cooling atmosphere. CloseCircuit: The fluid is separated from the atmosphere by a heat exchanger. Wet: The air stream or the heat exchange surface is evaporatively cooled. Dry: No evaporation into the air stream. DryWet: A combination of a dry tower and a wet tower.

contents.name: controlStrategy
contents.comment: Property. FixedExitingWaterTemp: The capacity is controlled to maintain a fixed exiting water temperature. WetBulbTempReset: The set-point is reset based on the wet-bulb temperature.

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: flowArrangement
contents.comment: Property. CounterFlow: Air and water flow enter in different directions. CrossFlow: Air and water flow are perpendicular. ParallelFlow: air and water flow enter in same directions.

contents.name: hasManufacturer
contents.comment: Property. A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.

contents.name: hasModel
contents.comment: Property. A relationship identifying the model of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.

contents.name: liftElevationDifference
contents.comment: Property. Elevation difference between cooling tower sump and the top of the tower. Usually measured in millimeters (mm).

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: nominalCapacity
contents.comment: Property. Nominal capacity. Usually measured in Watts (W, J/s).

contents.name: numberOfCells
contents.comment: Property. Number of cells in one cooling tower unit.

contents.name: operationTemperatureMax
contents.comment: Property. Allowable operation ambient (air, fluid) temperature range. Usually measured in degrees Kelvin (K).

contents.name: operationTemperatureMin
contents.comment: Property. Allowable operation ambient (air, fluid) temperature range. Usually measured in degrees Kelvin (K).

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: sprayType
contents.comment: Property. SprayFilled: Water is sprayed into airflow. SplashTypeFill: water cascades over successive rows of splash bars. FilmTypeFill: water flows in a thin layer over closely spaced sheets.

contents.name: waterRequirement
contents.comment: Property. Make-up water requirement. Usually measured in m3/s.

contents.name: isSubSystemOf
contents.comment: Relationship. A reference to a system(s) that this Physical Object is part of.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
